repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Local Authorities Development
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Local Authorities
            Development Program Project for Senegal were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the willingness of the Government
            of Senegal (GoS) to move forward with decentralization
            agenda, during and after the project, cannot occur without
            clear frameworks and a strong enabling environment. A
            clearer legal framework is needed to support the development
            of contract management agency (CMA) beyond public works
            executing agency (agence d'execution de travaux
            d'interet public pour l'emploi) (AGETIP) and
            evolution of the municipal development agency (agence de
            developpement municipal) (MDA) as an institution focused on
            financing service delivery in communes (on behalf of the
            government). The use of the municipal contract had proven to
            be relevant all through the project. Although the
            implementation tools (urban, financial, and organizational
            audits) had proven relevant since the urban development and
            decentralization program (UDDP), it is necessary to
            complement them with performance-oriented tools, such as
            scaled public expenditure and financial assessment (PEFA),
            performance-based municipal contracts, set up of minimal
            conditions for equipment maintenance, among others.
            Opportunities for diversified sources of funding should be
            explored, along with a rethinking of the exact role of the MDA.

repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Local Authorities Development
            Program Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Local Authorities
            Development Program Project for Senegal are to: (a)
            strengthen the capacity of urban municipalities to improve
            resource mobilization, and municipal and urban management;
            and (b) increase access to and quality of public
            infrastructure and services in urban areas. The reallocation
            is necessary to cover the additional costs generated by
            additional works that appeared as crucial during the
            implementing of the interurban roads program in Dakar. These
            works have addressed, among others, the widening of certain
            roads, the sidewalks, purging and loading of old dump
            discovered in the hold of a program road, the change in the
            road structure to take in account existing oil pipes
            discovered under the road, and strengthening the axis
            passing through the wetland of Niayes, etc.

display_title.display_title:
Senegal - Local Authorities
            Development Program Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Local Authorities Development
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Local
            Authorities Development Project are to: strengthen the
            capacity of urban municipalities to improve resource
            mobilization, and municipal and urban management; and
            increase access to and quality of public infrastructure and
            services in urban areas. One key reason for slow
            disbursements is the delays in implementation of the
            investment program attributable to Public Works Executing
            Agency (AGETIP), which is carrying out the work program for
            48 communes. Although AGETIP is a well-managed entity, it
            was overloaded with many other programs and suffered a lack
            of efficient oversight. The closing date for Senegal, Local
            Authorities Development Project, will be extended from
            December 31, 2011 until September 30, 2013. This will be the
            first extension of the project.
